title: BBC Hull & East Yorkshire Live Wednesday 22 June 2016 - BBC News
summary: east riding councillor dominic peacock is expelled from the local conservative party over offensive posts about late mp jo cox .
it 's the final day of campaigning in the eu referendum .
energy efficient prefab houses built in hull could help with shortage of social housing .

documents.title: our live coverage today
text: local live will finish at 18:00 .
we 're back from 08:00 tomorrow with more news from around the area .
join us then .
author: Jen Bateman
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: freedom festival acts announced
text: hull 's freedom festival has `` a very international '' flavour this year .
so says its artistic director , mikey martins .
we 're promised over 200 free performances and up to 70 different individuals or artistic companies showcasing their skills .
the three day festival runs from 2-4 september and 'celebrates , through artistic and cultural expression , hull 's independent spirit and historic contribution to the cause of freedom . '
author: Andy Marsters
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: watch : tonight 's headlines from look north
text: join peter levy on bbc one at 19:30 tonight for the latest news for east yorkshire and lincolnshire , it 's on a bit later because of the football .
here are the headlines with @ twitterid

documents.title: your chance to have a say on bus services
text: bus users in hull are being asked for their views on services as the city council carries out a review of its subsidies for some routes .
the council is looking to save £ 50,000 .
it currently offers subsidies to bus companies for local services where there is a `` social need '' because the fares would n't cover the cost of transport .
a number of services are being reviewed .
these include the the 1d , the 1e , the 9 , the 16 and the 50 .
starting tomorrow , daily consultation events are being held on weekdays until next tuesday , and there 's an online survey .
the deadline to tell the council your views is the 22 july .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: headlines across hull and east yorkshire
text: the latest headlines from our hull newsroom :
author: Natalie Glanvill
Reporter BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: man arrested after attempted theft of site equipment
text: humberside police have arrested a 21-year-old-man after a theft in goole last night .
a compressor was taken from a building site and loaded onto a land rover which was then involved in a collision on the slip road to the ouse bridge .
two people ran off towards a nearby farm but a search involving the police helicopter saw one of them caught .
humberside police are still looking for the second person and a white range rover .
author: Jen Bateman
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : weather across hull and east yorkshire
text: abbie dewhurst has the forecast for this afternoon and tomorrow across east yorkshire and lincolnshire .

documents.title: freedom festival lineup
text: the line up 's been announced for this year 's freedom festival .
it 's promising something for everyone as usual with world class art , dance , theatre , street performance and music .
one of the highlights is a piece of aerial theatre called `` as the world tipped '' which is described as `` gasp worthy '' .
the headliners are british sea power .
organisers have tweeted about their interview on bbc radio humberside with david burns
@ bbcburnsy @ twitterid you can watch the @ twitterid launch film over and over again here # freedomhull
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: sport : north ferriby united lose nicholson
text: tom nicholson has signed for halifax from north ferriby united .
another one heads west # nfu

documents.title: allotments to get security
text: £ 1000 has been raised to help with repairs to a number of allotments in cottingham which were vandalised earlier this month .
the money will be spent on cctv and improving security .

documents.title: hull fc : pritchard excited for challenge cup
text: hull fc : pritchard excited for challenge cup

documents.title: breakingjo cox online abuse councillor expelled from conservative group
text: councillor dominick peacock ( been expelled from the conservative group on east riding of yorkshire council .
it follows comments he made on social media regarding the fund in memory of the mp jo cox who was killed last week .
mr peacock has apologised and deleted the remark .
he remains a councillor , but as an independent .
at today 's meeting of the full conservative group on the east riding of yorkshire council , it was agreed to expel councillor dominic peacock with immediate effect . ''

documents.title: weather across hull and east yorkshire
text: variable cloud still lingering in most places and it will continue to do so for much of the day .
we could see more in the way of hazy sun this afternoon but it will start to feel increasingly humid and we 're at risk of seeing some heavy , thundery downpours this evening .
another warm day with highs of 21c .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: change of polling station
text: radio humberside politics reporter sarah sanderson is tweeting that there 's a change to one of the polling stations for tomorrow 's eu referendum .
due to break-in , the social hall # euref polling station on 1st avenue in # hull has changed to the nearby clowes memorial methodist church .
officers have been given tickets to allocate to people in the queue if they ca n't get in the building before 10 .
# euref

documents.title: medal stolen in hull house burglary
text: this former soldier 's medal has been stolen .
arron gorbutt was awarded it for serving in afghanistan .
it was stolen when his house on victoria dock in hull was burgled at the weekend .
arron got in touch with us through our facebook page and says he ca n't understand why someone would do this .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: toughest alive ?
text: humberside fire and rescue are sending a team to poland to take part in the toughest firefighter alive competition .

it 's been described as the ironman for firefighters , during the competition teams have to complete a number of tasks including : a hose run , an obstacle course , tower assault and stair climbing all in full firefighting gear .
good luck !
good luck to our team of 4 heading for poland to the toughest firefighter alive competition # keepstrong
this sounds wonderful and exciting !
we 'd love to talk to you about this for @ twitterid - what do you think ?
good luck guys
if there was ever a team to going to bring back a medal it 's definitely this group # bethebest

documents.title: headlines across hull and east yorkshire
text: here are the latest headlines from our newsroom in hull
author: Natalie Glanvill
Reporter BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: watch : learning without desks
text: the children at sirius academy in hull are not using their desks or chairs today for half of their lesson times .
instead they are learning .
to use more practical methods .
the idea is to improve learning and increase fitness , even the teachers are standing up in staff meetings and assembly .
balloons between legs - a maths class with a difference !
hull 's @ twitterid has active lessons @ twitterid
author: Jill Archbold
BBC Look North

documents.title: jo cox online abuse councillor could be expelled
text: the east riding of yorkshire conservative group is meeting at 13:00 bst to discuss whether or not to expel cllr dominic peacock .
cllr peacock has already been suspended both from the local conservative group on the council and the national conservative party .
it follows comments he made on social media about a fund set up in memory of mp jo cox who was killed last week .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: taking a stand at a school with a difference
text: schoolchildren in hull are going to be getting moving in the classroom as part of a project to get them fitter and improve their learning .
`` hull schools stand up '' will see children standing for half of their lesson times today as well as in assembly and even the teachers will be standing in staff meetings .
students at @ twitterid wo n't be sitting down today !
hear more @ twitterid shortly
author: Natalie Glanvill
Reporter BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: jo cox online abuse councillor to face disciplinary procedure
text: east riding of yorkshire cllr dominic peacock has been suspended from the conservative party over comments he posted online about a fund set up in memory of the mp jo cox , who was shot and stabbed last thursday .
a spokesman for the party in london said mr peacock would be dealt with through the party 's disciplinary procedures .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: eu referendum polling day tomorrow
text: on thursday 23 june , the uk will go the polls in the eu referendum .
here 's how to vote .
voting in the referendum takes place between 07:00 and 22:00 bst .
provided you are at the polling station at 22:00 bst , you will be guaranteed the opportunity to vote .
the referendum will decide whether the uk should leave or remain in the european union .
you will be asked to answer the following question : `` should the united kingdom remain a member of the european union or leave the european union ? ''
whichever side gets more than half of all votes cast is considered to have won .
we are running an earlier service than usual on friday to reflect the results .
join us from 06:00 to find out whether it 's in or out .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: watch : modular house tour
text: the social housing crisis across the uk could be solved by following the example of a project in hull .
amanda white has taken a tour of an energy efficient modular - or prefab as they used to be called - house .
the goodwin development trust is holding an open day after building five energy efficient prefab homes on the great thornton estate in hull .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

text: the earlier problems on the a1165 in hull and the a165 in brandesburton have both cleared .
just a little usual morning congestion in hull on the daltry street flyover and hessle road

documents.title: freedom festival headliners announced
text: the line-up for this september 's freedom festival in hull has been announced .
the band british sea power will headline the three-day event .
last year it brought more than 114,000 visitors to the city centre .

documents.title: traffic and travel across hull and east yorkshire
text: in hull there 's been an accident on one of the main commuting roads into the city , it 's causing some slow traffic in the area .
a1165 stoneferry road in hull partially blocked and slow traffic at the a1033 mount pleasant junction because of an accident involving a lorry and a motorbike .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: prefab houses for the future
text: amanda white is tweeting about modular or prefab houses in hull , a three bedroom home can be built in as little as three weeks .
it 's claimed it could help address the social housing crisis in the country .
the goodwin development trust has built five energy-efficient prefab homes in the city .
community groups from across the uk are coming to hull to see if prefab could solve housing need @ twitterid
what housing needs ?
did n't we bulldoze loads of empty houses a few years back ?
have i missed something ?
i dare say we both have .
the news has been muted in my house for the past 6 weeks .
self preservation/ sanity maintenance !
i 'm watching the news through my fingers .
too bleak .
i confidently expect to hear that michael palin has been vaporised .
that 's how we should be building houses .
not sticking bits of baked clay together with gob .
author: Jen Bateman
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel across hull and east yorkshire
text: the usual congestion in the usual places this morning , but we 've just heard of an accident in east yorkshire that might affect your travel .
the a165 bridlington road is blocked with queuing traffic in both directions between the main street junction in brandesburton and the fisher lane junction in lissett , because of an accident .
more on this later .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather across hull and east yorkshire
text: a dry and bright start to the day with some sunny spells .
through the morning cloud will increase with some outbreaks of light rain in places .
during the afternoon some bright or sunny spells are likely especially across the north
author: BBC Weather
